main_definition: Unwavering in purpose or effort, continuing to do something despite difficulties or obstacles.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Continuously present or occurring over a period of time.
meanings_and_examples.example: Despite many setbacks, her persistent efforts eventually led to success.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Refusing to stop or give up easily.
meanings_and_examples.example: His persistent attempts to solve the problem paid off when he finally figured it out after hours of effort.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Tending to stick or adhere firmly, as in an unyielding manner.
meanings_and_examples.example: The glue was so persistent that it stuck to his fingers for days.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Having a fixed tendency to do something repeatedly without variation.
meanings_and_examples.example: She had the persistent habit of biting her nails whenever she felt anxious.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Refusing to be discouraged or dissuaded from an action, goal, or course of conduct.
meanings_and_examples.example: His persistent advocacy for environmental protection eventually led to policy changes in the city.
